tagline: A simple library for encoding QR code in the iOS.
body:
### What is Qco?
Qco is a simple Objective-C library for encode QR code. I have designed this library so that we could create a QR code easily. Qco is an acronym of "**Q**R code **C**reator of **O**bjective-C". Please call it "Q-co".

This library is wrapper of C++ program. And it is used part of open source code at "Psytec Inc.".In detail, please refer to the following site.
* http://www.psytec.co.jp/freesoft/02/  (Japanese only.)

### How to install.
1. Download Qco and build the project. 
2. Add "QCQRCode.h" and "libQco.a" in Xcode.
3. In [TARGETS] -> [Build Phase] -> [Link Binary With Library], add "libQco.a", "UIKit.framework", "Foundation.framework" and "CoreGraphics.framework".
4. Rename implementation file as follow. Because this library is wrapped C++ source code.

```
 XXXX.m -> XXXX.mm
```

### How to use.
Qco has been designed to be able to make QR code in three steps.

1. Initialize.
2. Set parameters. (Option)
3. Encode.

```
#inclide "QCQRCode.h"
...
// Initialize
QCQRCode * encoder = [[QCQRCode alloc] init];
// Set parameters.
encoder.moduleSize = 10;
// Encode
UIImage * qrcode = [encoder encodeWithText:@"Hello Qco."];
```
In detail, please check header file (QRCRCode.h).

### Sample Code
* [QcoSampleCode](https://github.com/sbkro/QcoSampleCode-iOS)

### License
MIT Licence. 

### Operating Environment
* OSX Lion 10.7.4
* Xcode 4.3.3
* iOS 5.1

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Please check my page. I’ll help you sort it out.
* [My GitHub page](https://github.com/sbkro)
* [Qco wiki (en)](https://github.com/sbkro/Qco_for_iOS/wiki/Qco-for-iOS-manual-page.)
* [Qco wiki (jp)](https://github.com/sbkro/Qco_for_iOS/wiki/Qco-for-iOS-マニュアル)
